meanings.definition: a person or thing that encloses or surrounds something
meanings.sent1: The enclosers of the garden kept the rabbits out.
meanings.sent2: The enclosers around the field protected the crops from animals.
meanings.sent3: The enclosers of the treasure chest were so strong that even pirates couldn't open it.
meanings.sent4: Her arms were like enclosers, wrapping around me in a warm hug.
meanings.sent5: The enclosers of the zoo made sure the animals stayed safe and secure.

meanings.definition: a device or structure used to enclose or contain something
meanings.sent1: The metal enclosers around the construction site kept people out for safety.
meanings.sent2: The enclosers for the electrical wires protected them from the weather.
meanings.sent3: The enclosers for the cookies were so effective that no one could resist them.
meanings.sent4: The enclosers of the music box held the sweet melody inside.
meanings.sent5: The enclosers of the garden shed kept the tools organized and dry.
